required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesic Effect of Paracetamol in Patients With Femur Fracture: is Intravenous Better Than Oral?
clinical_study.official_title: Analgesic Effect of Paracetamol in Patients With Femur Fracture: is Intravenous Better Than Oral?

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to monitor severe pain for femur fracture after treatment with paracetamol IV or OR.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators enrolled 170 consecutive patients with femur fracture and severe pain. The patients received an initial analgesic treatment with paracetamol orally (OR) or intravenously (IV). The primary outcome was the reduction of pain of 1 point at visual analogue scale for pain (VAS) after the 1 st hour of treatment (T1). Secondary endpoints included the reduction of pain of at least 2 points on the VAS scale at the 4 th hour (T4), the need of rescue therapy and the number of adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain change of 1 point at visual analogue scale for pain (VAS) after the 1 st hour of treatment (T1).
primary_outcome.description: The Visual Analogue Scale for Pain (VAS) is a validated self-reported instrument that identifies pain from 0 to 10 (with 0 = no pain and 10 = maximum pain intensity)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain change of at least 2 points on the VAS scale at the 4 th hour (T4)
secondary_outcome.description: identifies pain from 0 to 10 (with 0 = no pain and 10 = maximum pain intensity)

arm_group.description: Patients with femur fracture that received an initial analgesic treatment with paracetamol intravenously (IV).
Patients with femur fracture that received an initial analgesic treatment with paracetamol orally (OR).

study_pop.textblock: Patients with femur fracture admitted to the ED of Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli, IRCCS, Rome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Patients admitted to the ED of Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli, IRCCS, Rome
- Femur Fracture
- Patients who signed the informed consent
- Able to take analgesic therapy both orally (OR) and intravenously (IV)
- Able to define pain by VAS
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Allergy to paracetamol
- Unable to take analgesic therapy both orally (OR) and intravenously (IV)
- Unable to define pain by VAS

facility.name: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli, IRCCS

patient_data.ipd_description: All IPD that underlie results of the publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The data will be available immediately and ending 3 years after the publication of the study.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Proposals should be directed to francesco.franceschi@policlinicogemelli.it. To gain access, requestors will need to sign a data access agreement.
